headline: Old-Fashioned Coconut Cream Pie
description: This coconut cream pie is made with a homemade coconut custard filling that's set in a pie shell and covered with whipped topping and toasted coconut.

video.description: It's creamy, it's coconutty, it's perfect. Enjoy.
video.name: Old-Fashioned Coconut Cream Pie

name: Old-Fashioned Coconut Cream Pie

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spread coconut on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Combine half-and-half, sugar, flour, eggs, and salt in a medium pot. Bring to a boil over low heat, stirring constantly. Continue cooking and stirring for 2 minutes more.
Remove the pan from the heat and stir in 3/4 cup toasted coconut and vanilla; reserve remaining toasted coconut for garnishing the pie.
Pour custard into pie shell and chill until firm, about 4 hours.
Top with whipped topping and reserved toasted coconut.

review.reviewBody: Easy recipe tastes great, only thing I did not do was toast the coconut I think It tastes better or more coconuty if that’s a work without toasting it

Followed this recipe and the comments - it thickens up perfectly! Delicious vanilla custard taste!!!! You have to be patient I stirred mine for 15 minutes on medium. When it bubbled I stirred two more minutes. Refrigerated three hours. Ready to eat!

It was thickening as I was putting it in the crust. Theres no way it won't set. I cooked it on low stirring it the whole time for almost an hour. Once it thickened I raised the heat to a little over medium. Then cooked for 2 minutes after it began to boil. Patience is key.. I didn't change a thing. Good recipe.
Very good recipe!
It was very good and I wouldn't change a think!

I made the recipe as stated. It is perfect as long as it is cooked enough. Those who say it is too liquid have probably not patiently stirred and cooked enough. I stir it until it thickens to almost pudding texture. It is a terrific recipe which I have made several times.

As others have stated, I followed the directions Exactly, and it came out beautifully. I do think it taste better the next day because the flavors have had more time to settle. I I’ve never made a coconut cream pie before, so I was nervous. But it was firm and perfectly set and tasted fantastic!
Followed the recipe exactly as it is and it turned out perfectly!

I’ve made this dozens of times over the years. It is always a hit and the most requested dessert I make. For those of you saying it does not set, you must stir constantly and cook on medium/high heat until it comes to a low boil. Once it starts bubbling it has usually thickened. And then u take it off and add coconut and vanilla. Put it in the pie crust and let it cool. Then I stick it in the refrigerator for awhile and then put the topping on it.
Honey, if you don't love this recipe - you're doing it wrong. Absolute favorite for anyone I've made it for. I use 18% cream and always use real vanilla. Lovely and simple to prepare.
It did not set at all, until I added cornstarch (lots of it!!!!)
Superb and I used 1 can of coconut milk, thus reducing cream in half and only half cup of sugar. Easy and delicious!
Family favorite

I always try a recipe as presented before making a comment which I did here. It was very bland and starting it on Lo heat did not work so I increased it to medium which did work in about 20 minutes. I will make it again and try the coconut milk and cornstarch suggested by others.

This is a fine recipe I have utilized several times with great success. It’s simple and delicious as it should be. I would suggest people who wish to rate a recipe actually make the recipe before changing it. In response to all the individuals saying it doesn’t set, I added a picture of what it looks like pre whipped topping for your viewing pleasure. If you change 6 things in the recipe , you are no longer rating said recipe…
The best! Super easy to make. So delicious!

I have searched and made many cream pies in the past. Some turned out awesome and others had to be eaten with a spoon! However, this recipe was super easy and super fast to make. I, as many suggested, substituted the milk for a full can of coconut milk and topped it off with whole milk to total 3 cups. I DID toast the coconut. It was amazingly delicious and simple to make! If I could make 1 change, I’d add an additional 1/2 cup of sugar.

Loved this pie!! Made the following changes, subbed 1/2 cups of coconut milk for 1/2 of the half and half. Also subbed corn starch for the flour. Made this twice, first time in the microwave and I didn't like it that way, did not set right. The second time I cooked it on the stove and that was so much better. I used pastry pride to top it with and that was delish!! Not too sweet!

I was trying to re-create my husband favorite coconut cream pie from Publix and used this recipe with the adjustments others mentioned. I used half heavy whipping cream and half coconut milk for the base and substituted corn starch for the flower. What really helped me was to watch a video of the pie being made on YouTube which provided me with extra info that isn’t in these directions. For example, this recipe just says to combine all the ingredients in one pot and bring it to a boil. Well it’s slightly more complicated than that if you want a good result.
This was awesome! Bar none!

Loved it! I followed the recipe but substituted half of the cream for canned coconut milk. Just used 2 large egg yolks instead of the whole eggs. Used the flour like the recipe called for and the custard thickened up great and tasted delicious! Can’t wait to taste it in the pie topped with whipped cream.
Excellent cream pie ! The best, and I did not change a thing! Thank you for sharing! Laurie
Absolutely fabulous! Best coconut cream pie ever!

Delicious pie! However, the next time I make it, I will reduce the thickening agent to 1/3 cup. The pie was a bit too firm. I followed the suggestions offered and substituted coconut milk for half of the liquid. I used 1 1/2 cups coconut milk and 1 1/2 cups half and half, which made a more coconut taste. I didn't need 1/4 cup of toasted coconut for the topping. Next time I make this I will use 7/8 cup of toasted coconut in the filling and 1/8 cup for the topping.

Awesome recipe with helpful reviews. All 6 of my guests enjoyed it thoroughly. I made it shortly before Easter and wanted to decorate it to look like a nest with Easter eggs on top; consequently I added crushed pretzels to be the sticks in the nest. The pretzels actually worked really well, flavor-wise, with the pie. So if you're a fan of salty-sweet desserts, try incorporating pretzels on top or in the crust.
Made it just like it is listed. Used real 36% cream rather than frozen topping. It is a 5 Star pie
I used three cups of canned coconut milk (two cans) instead of half and half and it worked just as great!

Followed the instructions to a T, I even made sure the half and half was hot before adding the flour and sugar… after an hour and a half in the refrigerator it never set!!! I had to pull it out, but it back on the stove, crank up the heat and put in some corn starch. The recipe should say to bring the liquid at a medium heat to a RAPID boil until thick! The recipe just said to cook it for 2 minutes (I cooked it even longer the first time and it still wasn’t enough).
I love this recipe. Everyone who's ever had it has loved it. I don't change the recipe at all. It's perfect.
SCANDALOUSLY DELICIOUS is what this pie is! It's an absolute WOW!
My daughter and I made this and it turned out amazing. Subbed 3 cups of half and half for 1 cup half and half, 1 cup coconut milk and 1 cup of whole milk. My first time tempering eggs.
Very easy Very good !
Absolutely delicious recipe, I forgot to take a pic but will definitely be making it again! Yummy!
I followed the recipe exactly and it was perfect. Not too sweet and perfect texture. So good!
I didn't find when the ingredients were in the pan they mixed well together either and I wasn't able to stir as it stuck together whilst stirring.
Great recipe. We loved it and will keep using this one for coconut pie!
Came out great! Super easy too.

I love this recipe! Always gets the "best pie I've ever made" comment. Anyone have any ideas of the best way to make a milk chocolate version? Cocoa powder or melted chocolate? Thanks for super recipe!

Love this recipe!!!
I whip up heavy cream for the topping.
The family loves it!

I made it as stated, and it came out beautifully. To those reviewers who said it doesn't set up, it likely was not cooked long enough. It DOES set up, it just takes a LONG time. You use medium low to medium heat and stir constantly, and, well, a watched pot never boils. It took a good 20 minutes to boil. I find the changes interesting, although they are then not the original recipe.
Very good pie, but very rich. Mine never boiled so I kind of had to just hope that it would solidify in the fridge overnight after a LONG TIME cooking on low heat, so I removed a star.

I have had CC pie all my life, usually too sweet or without enough coconut to taste.

This recipe is pure perfection.

The only tweak I would add is toast the coconut in a skillet rather than heating the whole house up with the oven.

It's faster and you get the same result. Just know that once it starts to brown, it browns very quickly because of the sugar. Stir, my little monkeys! Stir!
Made this pie exactly as directed with the exception of substituting 1/3 cup cornstarch for the 1/2 cup of flour. It is fantastic!

This is my GO TO for every occasion requiring me to bring a dish. I used 1 can coconut creme to replace half n half, then topped off with about 1 cup ½ n ½ as done by Shae1228 in her comment from 2017. I also used 3 yolks to replace the 2 eggs and corn starch to replace the flour. I don't like a lot of coconut in my pie, so I use only ¼ cup or less. I top it off with homemade whipped cream and toasted coconut. It's a hit. Everyone raves about it and insists I bake it for everything. My husband doesn't even like coconut, and he eats half this pie every time I bake one! Thanks Shae for the tips!
I've made this several times exactly as the recipe is written and it's DELICIOUS every time!

I make this recipe every few months for my daughter. It is super easy and the best I have ever had! I also use the vanilla pudding base for other things- like banana pudding and chocolate pudding. If you haven’t tried this recipe then you are missing out
Very good and easy.... I followed the tip and used 50% Half & Half and 50% Coconut Milk..... AWESOME!
Way too much flour, it really just tasted like flour. I have no idea why this has such high reviews.

SO GOOD. I've never had coconut cream pie before so I can't really compare it to anything lol. But I absolutely LOVED this recipe. Super easy to make, didn't taste overwhelmingly coconut-ty, but the flavour was still there. I set it in the fridge for 3 hours before serving, everybody liked it. 10/10!

I appreciate all of the input from other bakers, and took their advice to sub coconut milk and heavy cream for the half and half, and corn starch for the flour. The pie came out great, although I never got the custard to come to a boil. It still thickened up well enough, and set in about two hours.

This was absolutely delicious. However, I was afraid it might not turn out so good because it didn't set up properly in the beginning. After the 4 hours that it says to leave it in the fridge, I checked it and it was very runny. So, I left it overnight thinking it would be better in the morning. Unfortunately, it wasn't better in the morning. So, I scooped all the filling out into a pan and stirred on low heat until it was warmed up and then started adding just a little cornstarch at a time until it thickened up the way I wanted it. This was my first time making coconut cream pie and it was, like I said, absolutely DELISH! The only thing I did differently was add the entire tub of cool whip instead of just a cup that the recipe calls for. My hubby and my mom both loved it too. I will definitely be making it again using this recipe.

Made for Easter. Did not set!
Beware of recipe that needs changes made!! I did not read comments or reviews.

I used one can of coconut milk used half a half to make the total 3 cups. I used 2 yolks instead of whole eggs.I used at least a cup of coconut in the pie and toasted more for the top. I also substituted corn starch for the flour. And I did 1/2 tsp vanilla and 1/2 tsp coconut extract. It was delicious!
Disaster, did not set. The reviews giving it 5 stars made changes to it, why rate it ‘perfect’ if so many changes were needed? It was tasty runny pudding
This is awesome and I followed the recipe exactly. For the reviewer who said it didn't set all I can say is when making custard, patience is a virtue when it comes to the cooking process
The recipe has a big drawback. It says use 2 whole eggs. Should be just the yolks like Creme Brulee. Pie filling came out lumpy and rubbery.

Turned out perfect. Not sure why there are so many reviews saying it didn't set up... I wonder if they didn't boil it long enough for it to set... it set in about 2 hours in the fridge for us! Made homemade cool whip for the top and did add the full cup of coconut to the curd part! Also a friendly reminder to always spoon flour into the measuring cup! Never scoop it out with the measuring cup!

Awesome recipe, I've made it 6 times now. I tweek it a bit each time as others have said to fit our tastes, but the recipe is amazing as written. We've used it for banana cream, chocolate cream and my favorite coconut chocolate cream. Quit looking and start cooking!
I made this for my mother in law & she LOVED IT!!!

I used the modifications given by another commenter. I used 15 oz can of cream of coconut plus 1 1/2 C of half and half in place of the 3C of half and half, 3 egg yolks in place of the 2 eggs, corn starch in place of the flour, and 7 oz bag of sweetened flaked coconut toasted reserving 1/4 C added to the custard. I made it for my spouse and didn't think I would like it. Changed my mind, it is really good!
My daughter (now 17) has wanted this pie every Thanksgiving and Christmas for the past 3 or 4 years.

This is one of those pies everyone will remember you by. It’s going to call your name in the middle of the night from your fridge if there’s any left. You absolutely will sneak in to eat some. Modifications include: use entire can of Thai coconut milk and add half and half to make three cups. I used unsweetened coconut flakes and only toasted the topping ones. I also added more flakes to the custard by about 1/4 cup. I used a touch over 1/3 cup cornstarch instead of flour. I used two eggs and one additional yolk. Also I used the microwave whisking every minute until thick pudding consistency. (5-6 minutes). I bought a frozen deep dish pie crust and pre baked as instructed but don’t use the Gram cracker kind?. Make your own whip cream and be careful not to add too much powdered sugar. I can’t imagine how sweet this pie would be using suggested sweetened coconut. Use unsweetened! I would have used a bit of coconut extract in the whipped cream if I had some. I used vanilla extract. About 1/4 tsp. Usually buying frozen pie crust gives you two which will give you one shallow second pie. The recipe yields extra filling. Make one today! Make sure it came out properly by consuming the shallow pie when no one is home...

We made 2 of these coconut cream pies. Followed the recipe to the letter. They turned out beautiful. The trick is when it says to stir constantly, stir constantly. They were a hit. This is now my go to recipe!!
I've made it a couple of times. Sets up great. Great classic recipe. I use extra coconut.
SO good - I received so many compliments when I made this recipe.

The pie was delicious as is. The other variants sound good but it makes a completely different recipe. I was looking for a recipe like my grandma used to make and this was it! This was easy and didn’t take very long

Very good! I had to throw my first attempt away as I tried to cook dinner while making it, and you definitely have to stir constantly. The second try came out perfect, though, and didn't take long to disappear. This will be my go-to in the future for family gatherings. :-D
My Mom and husband say this is the best recipe and I should not try any others at this point. This is the one.
Made this, it was delicious! Made a home made pie shell and home made whipped cream instead of store bought. A definite keeper!

I made the recipe as stated, and it was fantastic! The recipe says to bring it to a boil while stirring constantly over low heat, but mine never came to a boil. It was about 20 minutes of constant stirring. I stopped when it became a pudding-like consistency. Everyone loved this pie!
I followed recipe as written (which everyone should do if you are going to rate it). It turned out quite nice. Please if you want to change the recipe go create your own!!!

I followed someones advice about a few changes.
 3 egg yolks instead of 2 eggs.
corn starch instead of flour
Coconut cream finishing off with 1/2 & 1/2

Set perfectly. Flavor perfect. Texture perfect. Sweetness off the charts. I would cut the coconut cream in half and use more cream next time. Finished it all. Needs a better topping
I followed the recipe exactly except I put in a graham cracker crust. It turned out great!

I've made this recipe twice in the last week and it has been a hit! I substituted the 3 cups of half and half with 1-1/2 cups of half and half and 1-1/2 cups of coconut cream for a richer creamier coconut flavor.
This was delicious!

I adjusted the recipe like shea1228 recommended and it was perfect! thank you! I also substituted the sugar with Splenda and could not taste a difference! maybe a little less sweeter but perfect! thank you! locking this one away!

I made the recipe as written and timed it for 2 minutes with a timer. I didn't care for the consistency as it came out way too thick. I think cornstarch instead of flour would have been a much better choice. One half cup of flour is far too much for the filling. Won't make this recipe again.
My husband loved this pie! However I think I cooked the filling a little too long because it wasn’t very creamy. Next time, I’ll cook a little less. Flavor was amazing!
Excellent recipe!
I used whipping cream for the topping

I've made it a few times. For the 3 cups of liquid, I always use a can of cocconut milk, and the rest, half and half. It gives it enough coconut flavor, so I leave out the extract, no need for it. I also use unsweetened coconut and cut the sugar to 1/2 cup, and it still was good.

Could not believe how easy and delicious this pie was. Of course, I make my own pastry. I believe the only mistake I made was to measure the flour and then sift it (flour today seems a bit heavy and lumpy). But after sifting I remeasured (the sifted flour was much more than the recipe required). As a result the custard did not get as firm as I would have liked. But nonetheless everyone loved the recipe and so did I. Perhaps the flour error was not an error.

Absolutely outstanding filling! 
 With the coconut milk, cream, and cornstarch changes as per other reviewers, what crust you use makes it or breaks it. The frozen Marie Callendar is the very best one to use for any regular pie crust. I am not a graham cracker crust lover and have found the new Diamond walnut crust perfect for this recipe. There is also pecan which I haven't tried yet...both in the ready crust area. They are very mild, light, and only slightly sweet, which I prefer.

This pie was “the best coconut custard pie I’ve ever had and I’ve tried so many” (per my husband) and I must agree, it’s incredible! Like many other reviewers mentioned, I used one can of coconut milk, and used heavy cream for the balance of the 3 cups of milk called for. I also subbed 3 egg yolks for the whole eggs. Finally, I made this in a double boiler which ended up taking about 30 minutes to fully thicken (175 degrees). I’m not sure if the double boiler is necessary, it’s just a nice insurance measure if you’re worried about overheating and curdling.

It came out pretty well considering that I didn’t wait for the filling to cool and I added the coconut flakes prematurely. Nice subtle coconut taste. Just follow the instructions as written and wait for the filling to cool thoroughly.
Perfect recipe! First time making a coconut cream pie and I am very happy with the results.

I just made this; it turned out great! If yours didn't set, turn up the heat and keep stirring (I used med to med hi). And, BEAT THE EGGS before adding them to the 1/2n1/2 (I used my hand mixer)! The video does not show this, but the instructions do. Also, there will be lumps of flour, keep heating and stirring; they will go away. I also decreased the sugar to 1/3 cup; I know my tastebuds. And, I used real whipped cream.

I followed the directions exactly. It came out like a heavy thick opaque paste and lacked sweetness. This might be better served in a cookie crust for sweetness. I'll go back to my recipe that uses corn starch and 4 egg yolks.
My husband loved it. So I will make it again.
It was my first time making this pie and it was very good.I did use fresh whipping cream and used coconut milk instead.Very easy to make.I like that there is no baking.
Made this for the 4th of July. Colored the the 1/4 cup of coconut for the top red and blue it was a hit .
My pies did not set...... all runny. So disappointed

I loved this pie It reminds me of my husband's grandma's pie. It the best!
I had no problem with the pie setting up. Grandma taught me to have lots of patience when making the filling. Low heat and lots of stirring until it thickens. It can take up to 20 minutes. Patience creates YUM!

Love the base of this recipe but I did make some changes. First, 3/4 cup sugar is way too much for me - I used 1/4 cup. I also don’t use half and half, I use full fat unsweetened coconut milk. Other than that, it’s all the same! Great recipe.
This turned out exactly how I imagined. I followed the recommendations, using coconut milk and corn starch.

Based on previous custard making experience, I mixed all the dry ingredients in the saucepan, added 3 cups of evaporated milk (I did not have half and half), whisked vigorously and brought that to a boil, stirring constantly. I then tempered the 2 eggs with a little of the hot liquid and gradually added the egg mixture back to the saucepan and allowed that to thicken. I did this while toasting 1 1/2 cups of coconut. All the coconut got mixed in the hot custard and dumped into the pie crust. Made this way, the custard set up without a problem and everyone thought it tasted wonderfully.

This pie was amazing. Followed the advice of others and used a can of coconut milk and enough half-n-half to equal 3 cups. Used 1/2c flour and 1/2c corn starch for thickening and did not toast coconut that was mixed into the custard. Microwave in 1 minute intervals also worked beautifully. This pie will be a go-to dessert from now on!

I made this recipe just as the directions told me to using just the half and half it set up nicely. The trick is you gotta bring the filling to full boil stirring constantly. The is truly a great pie.

I have made the 3 times since I came upon the recipe. Printed it out and replaced the recipe I had been using for over 20 years with this one! It's excellent. I like that it's not too sweet, and you cook the eggs from the start instead of adding later - which I find to be a pain and tricky. It's very easy too!
